question.text: From the underground part of the main stem, oblique branches may arise and come out of the soil to give rise to leafy shoots in

solution.text:
Stems may help in the spread of vegetative propagation.

Examples: (i) When older parts die new plants may develop from the underground stem: Grass, strawberry.
(ii) The lateral branch from stem grows aerially, arch and touch the ground downwards to give rise to new plants: Mint, jasmine.
(iii) Branch of stem growing laterally with short internodes and giving rise to leafy rosettes above and the tuft of roots below at the nodes: Aquatic plants like Eichhornia and Pistia.
(iv). Lateral branches may originate from the underground part of the main stem, grow obliquely, come out of the soil and give rise to leafy shoots: Banana, Chrysanthemum and pineapple.
